data.text:
Professor Max Born shakes hands with a chimney sweep in front of his Bad Pyrmont, Germany, home on Nov. 2, 1954. The 72-year-old physicist became well-known for his works in connection with the quantum theory. Professor Born immigrated to England in 1933 but returned to Germany after the war. Born was expected to win this year’s Nobel Prize in physics together with Prof. Walther Bothe of Heidelberg, Germany. (AP Photo/Henry Brueggemann)

Captions are provided by our contributors.
